page.title: 11OLD RAILWAY, BEDGEBURY AREA
page.content: A single-track railway was built from Paddock Wood to Hawkhurst in the 1890's, the Cranbrook and Hawkhurst stations being 2-3 km from the town centres. This was one of several small railways managed by Colonel Stephens. The line closed in 1961. Cranbrook station house has since been used as a pottery but is now empty. The top hectare of the old Cranbrook station yard is leased by an oil company whose offices are in the engine shed, a listed building. The other two hectares are leased to a subsidiary of the National Coal Board; various types of coal are stored here in pens built from old railway sleepers. Hawkhurst station yard is used by wood turners. The dismantled railway line is now in parts a Forestry Commission road, a footpath, and overgrown or blocked.
